00066             template<size_t nBits>

00069                 TreeNodePtr expr;

00073                 InsnSet defs;

00075             public:
00076 
00078                 ValueType(std::string comment="") {
00079                     expr = LeafNode::create_variable(nBits, comment);
00080                 }
00081 
00083                 ValueType(const ValueType &other) {
00084                     expr = other.expr;
00085                     defs = other.defs;
00086                 }
00087 
00089                 explicit ValueType(uint64_t n, std::string comment="") {
00090                     expr = LeafNode::create_integer(nBits, n, comment);
00091                 }
00092 
00094                 explicit ValueType(const TreeNodePtr &node) {
00095                     assert(node->get_nbits()==nBits);
00096                     expr = node;
00097                 }

00122                 void print(std::ostream &o, RenameMap *rmap=NULL) const {
00123                     o <<"defs={";

00125                     for (InsnSet::const_iterator di=defs.begin(); di!=defs.end(); ++di, ++ndefs) {

00127                         if (insn!=NULL)
00128                             o <<(ndefs>0?",":"") <<StringUtility::addrToString(insn->get_address());
00129                     }
00130                     o <<"} expr=";
00131                     expr->print(o, rmap);
00132                 }

00181                 const InsnSet& get_defining_instructions() const {
00182                     return defs;

00188                 size_t add_defining_instructions(const InsnSet &to_add) {
00189                     size_t nadded = 0;
00190                     for (InsnSet::const_iterator i=to_add.begin(); i!=to_add.end(); ++i) {
00191                         std::pair<InsnSet::iterator, bool> inserted = defs.insert(*i);
00192                         if (inserted.second)
00193                             ++nadded;
00194                     }
00195                     return nadded;
00196                 }
00197                 size_t add_defining_instructions(const ValueType &source) {
00198                     return add_defining_instructions(source.get_defining_instructions());
00199                 }
00200                 size_t add_defining_instructions(SgAsmInstruction *insn) {
00201                     InsnSet tmp;
00202                     if (insn)
00203                         tmp.insert(insn);
00204                     return add_defining_instructions(tmp);
00205                 }
00211                 void set_defining_instructions(const InsnSet &new_defs) {
00212                     defs = new_defs;
00213                 }
00214                 void set_defining_instructions(const ValueType &source) {
00215                     set_defining_instructions(source.get_defining_instructions());
00216                 }
00217                 void set_defining_instructions(SgAsmInstruction *insn) {
00218                     InsnSet tmp;
00219                     if (insn)
00220                         tmp.insert(insn);
00221                     return set_defining_instructions(tmp);
00222                 }

00235             template<template<size_t> class ValueType=SymbolicSemantics::ValueType>
00236             class MemoryCell {
00237             private:
00238                 ValueType<32> address_;                 
00239                 ValueType<8> value_;                    
00240                 bool written;                           
00242             public:
00243                 MemoryCell(const ValueType<32> &address, const ValueType<8> &value, SgAsmInstruction *insn=NULL)
00244                     : address_(address), value_(value) {
00245                     value_.add_defining_instructions(insn);
00246                 }
00247 
00249                 ValueType<32> address() const { return address_; }
00250 
00252                 ValueType<8> value() const { return value_; }
00253 
00259                 bool is_written() const { return written; }
00260                 void set_written(bool b=true) { written=b; }
00261                 void clear_written() { written=false; }
00267                 bool must_alias(const ValueType<32> &addr, SMTSolver *solver) const {
00268                     return this->address().get_expression()->equal_to(addr.get_expression(), solver);
00269                 }
00270 
00272                 bool may_alias(const ValueType<32> &addr, SMTSolver *solver) const {
00273                     if (must_alias(addr, solver))
00274                         return true;
00275                     if (!solver)
00276                         return false;
00277                     TreeNodePtr x_addr = this->address().get_expression();
00278                     TreeNodePtr y_addr = addr.get_expression();
00279                     TreeNodePtr assertion = InternalNode::create(1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EQ, x_addr, y_addr);
00280                     return SMTSolver::SAT_NO != solver->satisfiable(assertion);
00281                 }
00282 
00284                 template<typename PrintHelper>
00285                 void print(std::ostream &o, const std::string prefix="", PrintHelper *ph=NULL) const {
00286                     o <<prefix <<"address = { ";
00287                     address().print(o, ph);
00288                     o <<" }\n";
00289 
00290                     o <<prefix <<"  value = { ";
00291                     value().print(o, ph);
00292                     o <<" }\n";
00293 
00294                     o <<prefix <<"  flags = {";
00295                     if (!written) o <<" rdonly";
00296                     o <<" }\n";
00297                 }
00298 
00299                 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &o, const MemoryCell &mc) {
00300                     mc.print<BaseSemantics::SEMANTIC_NO_PRINT_HELPER>(o);
00301                     return o;
00302                 }
00303             };

00322             template<template <size_t> class ValueType=SymbolicSemantics::ValueType>
00323             class MemoryState {
00324             public:
00325                 typedef std::list<MemoryCell<ValueType> > CellList;
00326                 CellList cell_list;
00327                 bool read_pruning;                      
00329                 MemoryState(): read_pruning(true) {}
00330 
00333                 bool get_read_pruning() const { return read_pruning; }
00334                 void enable_read_pruning(bool b=true) { read_pruning = b; }
00335                 void disable_read_pruning() { read_pruning = false; }
00340                 template<size_t nBits>
00341                 CellList write(const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<nBits> &value, SMTSolver *solver) {
00342                     assert(8==nBits || 16==nBits || 32==nBits);
00343                     CellList retval;
00344                     for (size_t bytenum=0; bytenum<nBits/8; ++bytenum) {
00345                         MemoryCell<ValueType> cell = write_byte(add(addr, bytenum), extract_byte(value, bytenum), solver);
00346                         retval.push_back(cell);
00347                     }
00348                     return retval;
00349                 }
00350 
00353                 CellList read_byte(const ValueType<32> &addr, bool *found_must_alias/*out*/, SMTSolver *solver) {
00354                     CellList cells;
00355                     *found_must_alias = false;
00356                     if (read_pruning) {
00357                         for (typename CellList::iterator cli=may_alias(addr, solver, cell_list.begin());
00358                              cli!=cell_list.end();
00359                              cli=may_alias(addr, solver, ++cli)) {
00360                             cells.push_back(*cli);
00361                             if (cli->must_alias(addr, solver)) {
00362                                 *found_must_alias = true;
00363                                 break;
00364                             }
00365                         }
00366                     } else {
00367                         for (typename CellList::iterator cli=cell_list.begin(); cli!=cell_list.end(); ++cli) {
00368                             cells.push_back(*cli);
00369                             if (cli->must_alias(addr, solver))
00370                                 *found_must_alias = true;
00371                         }
00372                     }
00373                     return cells;
00374                 }
00375                 
00377                 ValueType<8> value_from_cells(const ValueType<32> &addr, const CellList &cells) {
00378                     assert(!cells.empty());
00379                     if (1==cells.size())
00380                         return cells.front().value();
00381                     // FIXME: This makes no attempt to remove duplicate values
00382                     TreeNodePtr expr = LeafNode::create_memory(8);
00383                     for (typename CellList::const_iterator ci=cells.begin(); ci!=cells.end(); ++ci) {
00384                         expr = InternalNode::create(8, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_WRITE,
00385                                                     expr, ci->address().get_expression(), ci->value().get_expression());
00386                     }
00387                     ValueType<8> retval(InternalNode::create(8, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_READ, expr, addr.get_expression()));
00388                     for (typename CellList::const_iterator ci=cells.begin(); ci!=cells.end(); ++ci)
00389                         retval.add_defining_instructions(ci->value().get_defining_instructions());
00390                     return retval;
00391                 }
00392  
00394                 MemoryCell<ValueType>& write_byte(const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<8> &value, SMTSolver *solver) {
00395                     typename CellList::iterator cli = must_alias(addr, solver, cell_list.begin());
00396                     if (cli!=cell_list.end())
00397                         cell_list.erase(cli);
00398                     MemoryCell<ValueType> new_cell(addr, value);
00399                     new_cell.set_written();
00400                     cell_list.push_front(new_cell);
00401                     return cell_list.front();
00402                 }
00403 
00405                 template<size_t nBits>
00406                 ValueType<8> extract_byte(const ValueType<nBits> &a, size_t bytenum) {
00407                     if (a.is_known())
00408                         return ValueType<8>((a.known_value()>>(bytenum*8)) & IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, 8>::value);
00409                     return ValueType<8>(InternalNode::create(8, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT,
00410                                                              LeafNode::create_integer(32, 8*bytenum),
00411                                                              LeafNode::create_integer(32, 8*bytenum+8),
00412                                                              a.get_expression()));
00413                 }
00414 
00416                 ValueType<32> add(const ValueType<32> &a, uint64_t n) {
00417                     if (0==n)
00418                         return a;
00419                     if (a.is_known())
00420                         return ValueType<32>(a.known_value()+n);
00421                     return ValueType<32>(InternalNode::create(32, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ADD,
00422                                                               a.get_expression(), LeafNode::create_integer(32, n)));
00423                 }
00424 
00426                 typename CellList::iterator must_alias(const ValueType<32> &addr, SMTSolver *solver,
00427                                                        typename CellList::iterator begin) {
00428                     for (typename CellList::iterator cli=begin; cli!=cell_list.end(); ++cli) {
00429                         if (cli->must_alias(addr, solver))
00430                             return cli;
00431                     }
00432                     return cell_list.end();
00433                 }
00434 
00436                 typename CellList::iterator may_alias(const ValueType<32> &addr, SMTSolver *solver,
00437                                                       typename CellList::iterator begin) {
00438                     for (typename CellList::iterator cli=begin; cli!=cell_list.end(); ++cli) {
00439                         if (cli->may_alias(addr, solver))
00440                             return cli;
00441                     }
00442                     return cell_list.end();
00443                 }
00444 
00446                 template<typename PrintHelper>
00447                 void print(std::ostream &o, const std::string prefix="", PrintHelper *ph=NULL) const {
00448                     for (typename CellList::const_iterator cli=cell_list.begin(); cli!=cell_list.end(); ++cli)
00449                         cli->print(o, prefix, ph);
00450                 }
00451             };

00533             protected:

00535 
00536                 SgAsmInstruction *cur_insn;         
00537                 mutable State<ValueType> orig_state;
00548                 mutable State<ValueType> cur_state;

00559                 size_t ninsns;

00564             public:
00565 
00567                 Policy() {
00568                     init();
00569                     /* So that named values are identical in both; reinitialized by first call to startInstruction(). */
00570                     orig_state = cur_state;
00571                 }
00572 
00574                 Policy(SMTSolver *solver) {
00575                     init();
00576                     this->solver = solver;
00577                     /* So that named values are identical in both; reinitialized by first call to startInstruction(). */
00578                     orig_state = cur_state;
00579                 }
00580

00583                     set_register_dictionary(RegisterDictionary::dictionary_pentium4());
00584                     cur_insn = NULL;
00585                     p_discard_popped_memory = false;
00586                     ninsns = 0;
00587                     solver = NULL;
00588                 }

00684 
00687                 template <size_t FromLen, size_t ToLen>
00688                 ValueType<ToLen> unsignedExtend(const ValueType<FromLen> &a) const {
00689                     ValueType<ToLen> retval;
00690                     if (a.is_known()) {
00691                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t,ToLen>::value & a.known_value());
00692                     } else if (FromLen==ToLen) {
00693                         // no-op, so not defined by current insn
00694                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(a.get_expression());
00695                     } else if (FromLen>ToLen) {
00696                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(InternalNode::create(ToLen, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT,
00697                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, 0),
00698                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, ToLen),
00699                                                                        a.get_expression()));
00700                     } else {
00701                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(InternalNode::create(ToLen, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_UEXTEND,
00702                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, ToLen),
00703                                                                        a.get_expression()));
00704                     }
00705                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00706                     return retval;
00707                 }
00708 
00710                 template <size_t FromLen, size_t ToLen>
00711                 ValueType<ToLen> signedExtend(const ValueType<FromLen> &a) const {
00712                     ValueType<ToLen> retval;
00713                     if (a.is_known()) {
00714                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(IntegerOps::signExtend<FromLen, ToLen>(a.known_value()));
00715                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00716                     } else if (FromLen==ToLen) {
00717                         // no-op, so not defined by current insns
00718                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(a.get_expression());
00719                         retval.defined_by(NULL, a.get_defining_instructions());
00720                     } else if (FromLen > ToLen) {
00721                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(InternalNode::create(ToLen, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT,
00722                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, 0),
00723                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, ToLen),
00724                                                                        a.get_expression()));
00725                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00726                     } else {
00727                         retval = ValueType<ToLen>(InternalNode::create(ToLen, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SEXTEND,
00728                                                                        LeafNode::create_integer(32, ToLen),
00729                                                                        a.get_expression()));
00730                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00731                     }
00732                     return retval;
00733                 }
00734 
00738                 template <size_t BeginAt, size_t EndAt, size_t Len>
00739                 ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt> extract(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
00740                     ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt> retval;
00741                     if (0==BeginAt) {
00742                         retval = unsignedExtend<Len,EndAt-BeginAt>(a);
00743                     } else if (a.is_known()) {
00744                         retval = ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt>((a.known_value()>>BeginAt) &
00745                                                           IntegerOps::genMask<uint64_t>(EndAt-BeginAt));
00746                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00747                     } else {
00748                         retval = ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt>(InternalNode::create(EndAt-BeginAt, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT,
00749                                                                                LeafNode::create_integer(32, BeginAt),
00750                                                                                LeafNode::create_integer(32, EndAt),
00751                                                                                a.get_expression()));
00752                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
00753                     }
00754                     return retval;
00755                 }
00756 
00762                 ValueType<8> mem_read_byte(State<ValueType> &state, const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<8> &dflt) const {
00763                     typedef typename State<ValueType>::Memory::CellList CellList;
00764                     bool found_must_alias;
00765                     CellList cells = state.memory.read_byte(addr, &found_must_alias, solver);
00766                     if (!found_must_alias) {
00767                         if (&state!=&orig_state) {
00768                             /* We didn't find the exact (must-alias) memory cell in the specified state. See if we can find a
00769                              * value in the initial state, creating it there if necessary. */
00770                             CellList cells_init = orig_state.memory.read_byte(addr, &found_must_alias, solver);
00771                             cells.insert(cells.end(), cells_init.begin(), cells_init.end());
00772                             if (!found_must_alias) {
00773                                 MemoryCell<ValueType> &new_cell = orig_state.memory.write_byte(addr, dflt, solver);
00774                                 new_cell.clear_written();
00775                                 cells.push_back(new_cell);
00776                             }
00777                         }
00778                     }
00779                     return state.memory.value_from_cells(addr, cells);
00780                 }
00781 
00787                 template <size_t nBits>
00788                 ValueType<nBits> mem_read(State<ValueType> &state, const ValueType<32> &addr,
00789                                           const ValueType<nBits> *dflt=NULL) const {
00790                     assert(8==nBits || 16==nBits || 32==nBits);
00791                     typedef typename State<ValueType>::Memory::CellList CellList;
00792 
00793                     // Read bytes in little endian order.
00794                     ValueType<nBits> retval, defs;
00795                     std::vector<ValueType<8> > bytes; // little endian order
00796                     for (size_t bytenum=0; bytenum<nBits/8; ++bytenum) {
00797                         ValueType<8> dflt_byte = dflt ? state.memory.extract_byte(*dflt, bytenum) : ValueType<8>();
00798                         ValueType<8> byte = mem_read_byte(state, state.memory.add(addr, bytenum), dflt_byte);
00799                         defs.defined_by(NULL, byte.get_defining_instructions());
00800                         bytes.push_back(byte);
00801                     }
00802 
00803                     // Try to match the pattern of bytes:
00804                     //    (extract 0  8 EXPR_0)
00805                     //    (extract 8 16 EXPR_1)
00806                     //    ...
00807                     // where EXPR_i are all structurally identical.
00808                     bool matched = false;
00809                     if (bytes.size()>1) {
00810                         matched = true; // and prove otherwise
00811                         for (size_t bytenum=0; bytenum<bytes.size() && matched; ++bytenum) {
00812                             InternalNodePtr extract = bytes[bytenum].get_expression()->isInternalNode();
00813                             if (!extract || InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT!=extract->get_operator()) {
00814                                 matched = false;
00815                                 break;
00816                             }
00817                             LeafNodePtr arg0 = extract->child(0)->isLeafNode();
00818                             LeafNodePtr arg1 = extract->child(1)->isLeafNode();
00819                             if (!arg0 || !arg0->is_known() || arg0->get_value()!=8*bytenum ||
00820                                 !arg1 || !arg1->is_known() || arg1->get_value()!=8*(bytenum+1)) {
00821                                 matched = false;
00822                                 break;
00823                             }
00824                             if (bytenum>0) {
00825                                 TreeNodePtr e0 = bytes[0      ].get_expression()->isInternalNode()->child(2);
00826                                 TreeNodePtr ei = bytes[bytenum].get_expression()->isInternalNode()->child(2);
00827                                 matched = e0->equivalent_to(ei);
00828                             }
00829                         }
00830                     }
00831 
00832                     // If the bytes match the above pattern, then we can just return (the low order bits of) EXPR_0, otherwise
00833                     // we have to construct a return value by extending and shifting the bytes and bitwise-OR them together.
00834                     if (matched) {
00835                         TreeNodePtr e0 = bytes[0].get_expression()->isInternalNode()->child(2);
00836                         if (e0->get_nbits()==nBits) {
00837                             retval = ValueType<nBits>(e0);
00838                         } else {
00839                             assert(e0->get_nbits()>nBits);
00840                             retval = ValueType<nBits>(InternalNode::create(nBits, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EXTRACT,
00841                                                                            LeafNode::create_integer(32, 0),
00842                                                                            LeafNode::create_integer(32, nBits),
00843                                                                            e0));
00844                         }
00845                     } else {
00846                         for (size_t bytenum=0; bytenum<bytes.size(); ++bytenum) { // little endian
00847                             ValueType<8> byte = bytes[bytenum];
00848 
00849                             // extend byte
00850                             ValueType<nBits> word;
00851                             if (byte.is_known()) {
00852                                 word = ValueType<nBits>(byte.known_value());
00853                             } else if (nBits==8) {
00854                                 word = ValueType<nBits>(byte.get_expression());
00855                             } else {
00856                                 word = ValueType<nBits>(InternalNode::create(nBits, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_UEXTEND,
00857                                                                              LeafNode::create_integer(32, nBits),
00858                                                                              byte.get_expression()));
00859                             }
00860 
00861                             // left shift
00862                             if (0!=bytenum) {
00863                                 if (word.is_known()) {
00864                                     word = ValueType<nBits>(word.known_value() << (bytenum*8));
00865                                 } else {
00866                                     word = ValueType<nBits>(InternalNode::create(nBits, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SHR0,
00867                                                                                  LeafNode::create_integer(32, bytenum*8),
00868                                                                                  word.get_expression()));
00869                                 }
00870                             }
00871 
00872                             // bit-wise OR into the return value
00873                             if (0==bytenum) {
00874                                 retval = word;
00875                             } else if (retval.is_known() && word.is_known()) {
00876                                 retval = ValueType<nBits>(retval.known_value() | word.known_value());
00877                             } else {
00878                                 retval = ValueType<nBits>(InternalNode::create(nBits, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_BV_OR,
00879                                                                                retval.get_expression(), word.get_expression()));
00880                             }
00881                         }
00882                     }
00883 
00884                     retval.defined_by(NULL, defs.get_defining_instructions());
00885                     return retval;
00886                 }
00887 
00889                 template <size_t Len>
00890                 void mem_write(State<ValueType> &state, const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<Len> &data) {
00891                     ROSE_ASSERT(&state!=&orig_state);
00892                     typedef typename State<ValueType>::Memory::CellList CellList;
00893                     state.memory.write(addr, data, solver);
00894                 }
00895 
00896 
00897                 /*************************************************************************************************************
00898                  * Functions invoked by the X86InstructionSemantics class for every processed instructions
00899                  *************************************************************************************************************/
00900 
00902                 void startInstruction(SgAsmInstruction *insn) {
00903                     if (!cur_state.registers.ip.is_known()) {
00904                         // semantics user should have probably initialized EIP
00905                         cur_state.registers.ip = ValueType<32>(insn->get_address());
00906                     } else if (cur_state.registers.ip.known_value()!=insn->get_address()) {
00907                         fprintf(stderr, "SymbolicSemantics::Policy::startInstruction: invalid EIP value for current instruction\n\
00908     startInstruction() is being called for an instruction with a concrete\n\
00909     address stored in the SgAsmx86Instruction object, but the current value of\n\
00910     this policy's EIP register does not match the instruction.  This might\n\
00911     happen if you're processing instructions in an order that's different than\n\
00912     the order the policy thinks they would be executed.  If this is truly your\n\
00913     intent, then you need to set the policy's EIP register to the instruction\n\
00914     address before you translate the instruction--and you might want to make\n\
00915     sure the other state information is also appropriate for this instruction\n\
00916     rather than use the final state from the previously translated\n\
00917     instruction.  x86 \"REP\" instructions might be the culprit: ROSE\n\
00918     instruction semantics treat them as a tiny loop, updating the policy's EIP\n\
00919     depending on whether the loop is to be taken again, or not.\n");
00920                         std::cerr <<"ip = " <<cur_state.registers.ip <<"\n";
00921                         assert(cur_state.registers.ip.known_value()==insn->get_address()); // redundant, used for error mesg
00922                         abort(); // we must fail even when optimized
00923                     }
00924                     if (0==ninsns++)
00925                         orig_state = cur_state;
00926                     cur_insn = insn;
00927                 }
00928 
00930                 void finishInstruction(SgAsmInstruction*) {
00931                     if (p_discard_popped_memory)
00932                         cur_state.discard_popped_memory();
00933                     cur_insn = NULL;
00934                 }

00944                     ValueType<1> retval(1);
00945                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn);
00946                     return retval;
00947                 }

00950                 ValueType<1> false_() const {
00951                     ValueType<1> retval((uint64_t)0);
00952                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn);
00953                     return retval;
00954                 }

00958                 ValueType<Len> undefined_() const {
00959                     ValueType<Len> retval;
00960                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn);
00961                     return retval;
00962                 }

00965                 template <size_t Len>
00966                 ValueType<Len> number(uint64_t n) const {
00967                     ValueType<Len> retval(n);
00968                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn);
00969                     return retval;
00970                 }

01016                 /*****************************************************************************************************************
01017                  * Functions invoked by the X86InstructionSemantics class for arithmetic operations
01018                  *****************************************************************************************************************/
01019 
01021                 template <size_t Len>
01022                 ValueType<Len> add(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
01023                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01024                     if (a.is_known()) {
01025                         if (b.is_known()) {
01026                             retval = ValueType<Len>(LeafNode::create_integer(Len, a.known_value()+b.known_value()));
01027                             retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01028                             return retval;
01029                         } else if (0==a.known_value()) {
01030                             return b;
01031                         }
01032                     } else if (b.is_known() && 0==b.known_value()) {
01033                         return a;
01034                     }
01035                     retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ADD,
01036                                                                  a.get_expression(),
01037                                                                  b.get_expression()));
01038                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01039                     return retval;
01040                 }
01041 
01043                 template <size_t Len>
01044                 ValueType<Len> addWithCarries(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b, const ValueType<1> &c,
01045                                               ValueType<Len> &carry_out) const {
01046                     ValueType<Len+1> aa = unsignedExtend<Len, Len+1>(a);
01047                     ValueType<Len+1> bb = unsignedExtend<Len, Len+1>(b);
01048                     ValueType<Len+1> cc = unsignedExtend<1,   Len+1>(c);
01049                     ValueType<Len+1> sumco = add<Len+1>(aa, add<Len+1>(bb, cc));
01050                     carry_out = extract<1, Len+1>(xor_<Len+1>(aa, xor_<Len+1>(bb, sumco)));
01051                     return add<Len>(a, add<Len>(b, unsignedExtend<1, Len>(c)));
01052                 }
01053 
01055                 template <size_t Len>
01056                 ValueType<Len> and_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
01057                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01058                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01059                         retval = ValueType<Len>(a.known_value() & b.known_value());
01060                     } else {
01061                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_BV_AND,
01062                                                                      a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01063                     }
01064                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01065                     return retval;
01066                 }
01067 
01069                 template <size_t Len>
01070                 ValueType<1> equalToZero(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
01071                     ValueType<1> retval;
01072                     if (a.is_known()) {
01073                         retval = a.known_value() ? false_() : true_();
01074                     } else {
01075                         retval = ValueType<1>(InternalNode::create(1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ZEROP, a.get_expression()));
01076                     }
01077                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01078                     return retval;
01079                 }
01080 
01082                 template <size_t Len>
01083                 ValueType<Len> invert(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
01084                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01085                     if (a.is_known()) {
01086                         retval = ValueType<Len>(LeafNode::create_integer(Len, ~a.known_value()));
01087                     } else {
01088                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_INVERT, a.get_expression()));
01089                     }
01090                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01091                     return retval;
01092                 }
01093 
01095                 template<size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01096                 ValueType<Len1+Len2> concat(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01097                     ValueType<Len1+Len2> retval;
01098                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01099                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(a.known_value() | (b.known_value() << Len1));
01100                     } else {
01101                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(InternalNode::create(Len1+Len2, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_CONCAT,
01102                                                                            b.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));
01103                     }
01104                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01105                     return retval;
01106                 }
01107 
01109                 template <size_t Len>
01110                 ValueType<Len> ite(const ValueType<1> &sel, const ValueType<Len> &ifTrue, const ValueType<Len> &ifFalse) const {
01111                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01112                     if (sel.is_known()) {
01113                         retval = sel.known_value() ? ifTrue : ifFalse;
01114                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, sel.get_defining_instructions());
01115                         return retval;
01116                     }
01117                     if (solver) {
01118                         /* If the selection expression cannot be true, then return ifFalse */
01119                         TreeNodePtr assertion = InternalNode::create(1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EQ,
01120                                                                      sel.get_expression(),
01121                                                                      LeafNode::create_integer(1, 1));
01122                         bool can_be_true = SMTSolver::SAT_NO != solver->satisfiable(assertion);
01123                         if (!can_be_true) {
01124                             ValueType<Len> retval = ifFalse;
01125                             retval.defined_by(cur_insn, sel.get_defining_instructions());
01126                             return retval;
01127                         }
01128 
01129                         /* If the selection expression cannot be false, then return ifTrue */
01130                         assertion = InternalNode::create(1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_EQ,
01131                                                          sel.get_expression(), LeafNode::create_integer(1, 0));
01132                         bool can_be_false = SMTSolver::SAT_NO != solver->satisfiable(assertion);
01133                         if (!can_be_false) {
01134                             ValueType<Len> retval = ifTrue;
01135                             retval.defined_by(cur_insn, sel.get_defining_instructions());
01136                             return retval;
01137                         }
01138                     }
01139                     retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ITE, sel.get_expression(),
01140                                                                  ifTrue.get_expression(), ifFalse.get_expression()));
01141                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, sel.get_defining_instructions(),
01142                                       ifTrue.get_defining_instructions(), ifFalse.get_defining_instructions());
01143                     return retval;
01144                 }
01145 
01147                 template <size_t Len>
01148                 ValueType<Len> leastSignificantSetBit(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
01149                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01150                     if (a.is_known()) {
01151                         uint64_t n = a.known_value();
01152                         for (size_t i=0; i<Len; ++i) {
01153                             if (n & ((uint64_t)1 << i)) {
01154                                 retval = number<Len>(i);
01155                                 retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01156                                 return retval;
01157                             }
01158                         }
01159                         retval = number<Len>(0);
01160                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01161                         return retval;
01162                     }
01163                     retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_LSSB, a.get_expression()));
01164                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01165                     return retval;
01166                 }
01167 
01169                 template <size_t Len>
01170                 ValueType<Len> mostSignificantSetBit(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
01171                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01172                     if (a.is_known()) {
01173                         uint64_t n = a.known_value();
01174                         for (size_t i=Len; i>0; --i) {
01175                             if (n & ((uint64_t)1 << (i-1))) {
01176                                 retval = number<Len>(i-1);
01177                                 retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01178                                 return retval;
01179                             }
01180                         }
01181                         retval = number<Len>(0);
01182                         retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01183                         return retval;
01184                     }
01185                     retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_MSSB, a.get_expression()));
01186                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01187                     return retval;
01188                 }
01189 
01191                 template <size_t Len>
01192                 ValueType<Len> negate(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
01193                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01194                     if (a.is_known()) {
01195                         retval = ValueType<Len>(-a.known_value());
01196                     } else {
01197                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_NEGATE, a.get_expression()));
01198                     }
01199                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions());
01200                     return retval;
01201                 }
01202 
01204                 template <size_t Len>
01205                 ValueType<Len> or_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
01206                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01207                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01208                         retval = ValueType<Len>(a.known_value() | b.known_value());
01209                     } else {
01210                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_BV_OR,
01211                                                                      a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01212                     }
01213                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01214                     return retval;
01215                 }

01218                 template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>
01219                 ValueType<Len> rotateLeft(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<SALen> &sa) const {
01220                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01221                     if (a.is_known() && sa.is_known()) {
01222                         retval = ValueType<Len>(IntegerOps::rotateLeft<Len>(a.known_value(), sa.known_value()));
01223                     } else {
01224                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ROL,
01225                                                                      sa.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));
01226                     }
01227                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), sa.get_defining_instructions());
01228                     return retval;
01229                 }

01232                 template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>

01234                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01235                     if (a.is_known() && sa.is_known()) {
01236                         retval = ValueType<Len>(IntegerOps::rotateRight<Len>(a.known_value(), sa.known_value()));
01237                     } else {
01238                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_ROR,
01239                                                                      sa.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));
01240                     }
01241                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), sa.get_defining_instructions());
01242                     return retval;
01243                 }

01246                 template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>

01249                     if (a.is_known() && sa.is_known()) {
01250                         retval = ValueType<Len>(IntegerOps::shiftLeft<Len>(a.known_value(), sa.known_value()));
01251                     } else {
01252                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SHL0,
01253                                                                      sa.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));
01254                     }
01255                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), sa.get_defining_instructions());
01256                     return retval;

01260                 template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>

01264                         retval = ValueType<Len>(IntegerOps::shiftRightLogical<Len>(a.known_value(), sa.known_value()));
01265                     } else {
01266                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SHR0,
01267                                                                      sa.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));
01268                     }
01269                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), sa.get_defining_instructions());
01270                     return retval;

01274                 template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>

01279                     } else {

01281                                                                      sa.get_expression(), a.get_expression()));

01288                 template <size_t From, size_t To>
01289                 ValueType<To> signExtend(const ValueType<From> &a) {

01292 
01294                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01295                 ValueType<Len1> signedDivide(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01296                     ValueType<Len1> retval;
01297                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known() && 0!=b.known_value()) {
01298                         retval = ValueType<Len1>(IntegerOps::signExtend<Len1, 64>(a.known_value()) /
01299                                                  IntegerOps::signExtend<Len2, 64>(b.known_value()));
01300                     } else {
01301                         retval = ValueType<Len1>(InternalNode::create(Len1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SDIV,
01302                                                                       a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01303                     }
01304                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01305                     return retval;
01306                 }
01307 
01309                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01310                 ValueType<Len2> signedModulo(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01311                     ValueType<Len2> retval;
01312                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known() && 0!=b.known_value()) {
01313                         retval = ValueType<Len2>(IntegerOps::signExtend<Len1, 64>(a.known_value()) %
01314                                                  IntegerOps::signExtend<Len2, 64>(b.known_value()));
01315                     } else {
01316                         retval = ValueType<Len2>(InternalNode::create(Len2, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SMOD,
01317                                                                       a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01318                     }
01319                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01320                     return retval;
01321                 }
01322 
01324                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01325                 ValueType<Len1+Len2> signedMultiply(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01326                     ValueType<Len1+Len2> retval;
01327                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01328                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(IntegerOps::signExtend<Len1, 64>(a.known_value()) *
01329                                                       IntegerOps::signExtend<Len2, 64>(b.known_value()));
01330                     } else {
01331                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(InternalNode::create(Len1+Len2, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_SMUL,
01332                                                                            a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01333                     }
01334                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01335                     return retval;
01336                 }
01337 
01339                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01340                 ValueType<Len1> unsignedDivide(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01341                     ValueType<Len1> retval;
01342                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known() && 0!=b.known_value()) {
01343                         retval = ValueType<Len1>(a.known_value() / b.known_value());
01344                     } else {
01345                         retval = ValueType<Len1>(InternalNode::create(Len1, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_UDIV,
01346                                                                       a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01347                     }
01348                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01349                     return retval;
01350                 }
01351 
01353                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01354                 ValueType<Len2> unsignedModulo(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01355                     ValueType<Len2> retval;
01356                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known() && 0!=b.known_value()) {
01357                         retval = ValueType<Len2>(a.known_value() % b.known_value());
01358                     } else {
01359                         retval = ValueType<Len2>(InternalNode::create(Len2, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_UMOD,
01360                                                                       a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01361                     }
01362                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01363                     return retval;
01364                 }
01365 
01367                 template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
01368                 ValueType<Len1+Len2> unsignedMultiply(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
01369                     ValueType<Len1+Len2> retval;
01370                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01371                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(a.known_value()*b.known_value());
01372                     } else {
01373                         retval = ValueType<Len1+Len2>(InternalNode::create(Len1+Len2, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_UMUL,
01374                                                                            a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01375                     }
01376                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01377                     return retval;
01378                 }
01379 
01381                 template <size_t Len>
01382                 ValueType<Len> xor_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
01383                     ValueType<Len> retval;
01384                     if (a.is_known() && b.is_known()) {
01385                         retval = ValueType<Len>(a.known_value() ^ b.known_value());
01386                     } else if (a.get_expression()->equal_to(b.get_expression(), solver)) {
01387                         retval = number<Len>(0);
01388                     } else {
01389                         retval = ValueType<Len>(InternalNode::create(Len, InsnSemanticsExpr::OP_BV_XOR,
01390                                                                      a.get_expression(), b.get_expression()));
01391                     }
01392                     retval.defined_by(cur_insn, a.get_defining_instructions(), b.get_defining_instructions());
01393                     return retval;
01394                 }

01398                 /*****************************************************************************************************************
01399                  * Functions invoked by the X86InstructionSemantics class for data access operations
01400                  *****************************************************************************************************************/
01401 
01402 
01404                 template<size_t Len/*bits*/>
01405                 ValueType<Len> readRegister(const char *regname) {
01406                     return readRegister<Len>(findRegister(regname, Len));
01407                 }
01408 
01410                 template<size_t Len/*bits*/>
01411                 void writeRegister(const char *regname, const ValueType<Len> &value) {
01412                     writeRegister<Len>(findRegister(regname, Len), value);
01413                 }
01414 
01416                 template<size_t Len>
01417                 ValueType<Len> readRegister(const RegisterDescriptor &reg) {
01418                     switch (Len) {
01419                         case 1:
01420                             // Only FLAGS/EFLAGS bits have a size of one.  Other registers cannot be accessed at this
01421                             // granularity.
01422                             if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_flags)
01423                                 throw Exception("bit access only valid for FLAGS/EFLAGS register");
01424                             if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || reg.get_offset()>=cur_state.registers.n_flags)
01425                                 throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01426                             if (reg.get_nbits()!=1)
01427                                 throw Exception("semantic policy supports only single-bit flags");
01428                             return unsignedExtend<1, Len>(cur_state.registers.flag[reg.get_offset()]);
01429 
01430                         case 8:
01431                             // Only general-purpose registers can be accessed at a byte granularity, and we can access only the
01432                             // low-order byte or the next higher byte.  For instance, "al" and "ah" registers.
01433                             if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_gpr)
01434                                 throw Exception("byte access only valid for general purpose registers");
01435                             if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01436                                 throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01437                             assert(reg.get_nbits()==8); // we had better be asking for a one-byte register (e.g., "ah", not "ax")
01438                             switch (reg.get_offset()) {
01439                                 case 0:
01440                                     return extract<0, Len>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
01441                                 case 8:
01442                                     return extract<8, 8+Len>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
01443                                 default:
01444                                     throw Exception("invalid one-byte access offset");
01445                             }
01446 
01447                         case 16:
01448                             if (reg.get_nbits()!=16)
01449                                 throw Exception("invalid 2-byte register");
01450                             if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
01451                                 throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for word granularity register access");
01452                             switch (reg.get_major()) {
01453                                 case x86_regclass_segment:
01454                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_segregs)
01455                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01456                                     return unsignedExtend<16, Len>(cur_state.registers.segreg[reg.get_minor()]);
01457                                 case x86_regclass_gpr:
01458                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01459                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01460                                     return extract<0, Len>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
01461                                 case x86_regclass_flags:
01462                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || cur_state.registers.n_flags<16)
01463                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01464                                     return unsignedExtend<16, Len>(concat(cur_state.registers.flag[0],
01465                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[1],
01466                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[2],
01467                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[3],
01468                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[4],
01469                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[5],
01470                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[6],
01471                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[7],
01472                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[8],
01473                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[9],
01474                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[10],
01475                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[11],
01476                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[12],
01477                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[13],
01478                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[14],
01479                                                                           cur_state.registers.flag[15]))))))))))))))));
01480                                 default:
01481                                     throw Exception("word access not valid for this register type");
01482                             }
01483 
01484                         case 32:
01485                             if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
01486                                 throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for double word granularity"
01487                                                 " register access");
01488                             switch (reg.get_major()) {
01489                                 case x86_regclass_gpr:
01490                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01491                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01492                                     return unsignedExtend<32, Len>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
01493                                 case x86_regclass_ip:
01494                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
01495                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01496                                     return unsignedExtend<32, Len>(cur_state.registers.ip);
01497                                 case x86_regclass_segment:
01498                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_segregs || reg.get_nbits()!=16)
01499                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01500                                     return unsignedExtend<16, Len>(cur_state.registers.segreg[reg.get_minor()]);
01501                                 case x86_regclass_flags: {
01502                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || cur_state.registers.n_flags<32)
01503                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01504                                     if (reg.get_nbits()!=32)
01505                                         throw Exception("register is not 32 bits");
01506                                     return unsignedExtend<32, Len>(concat(readRegister<16>("flags"), // no-op sign extension
01507                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[16],
01508                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[17],
01509                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[18],
01510                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[19],
01511                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[20],
01512                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[21],
01513                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[22],
01514                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[23],
01515                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[24],
01516                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[25],
01517                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[26],
01518                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[27],
01519                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[28],
01520                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[29],
01521                                                                    concat(cur_state.registers.flag[30],
01522                                                                           cur_state.registers.flag[31])))))))))))))))));
01523                                 }
01524                                 default:
01525                                     throw Exception("double word access not valid for this register type");
01526                             }
01527 
01528                         default:
01529                             throw Exception("invalid register access width");
01530                     }
01531                 }
01532 
01534                 template<size_t Len>
01535                 void writeRegister(const RegisterDescriptor &reg, const ValueType<Len> &value) {
01536                     switch (Len) {
01537                         case 1:
01538                             // Only FLAGS/EFLAGS bits have a size of one.  Other registers cannot be accessed at this
01539                             // granularity.
01540                             if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_flags)
01541                                 throw Exception("bit access only valid for FLAGS/EFLAGS register");
01542                             if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || reg.get_offset()>=cur_state.registers.n_flags)
01543                                 throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01544                             if (reg.get_nbits()!=1)
01545                                 throw Exception("semantic policy supports only single-bit flags");
01546                             cur_state.registers.flag[reg.get_offset()] = unsignedExtend<Len, 1>(value);
01547                             cur_state.registers.flag[reg.get_offset()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01548                             break;
01549 
01550                         case 8:
01551                             // Only general purpose registers can be accessed at byte granularity, and only for offsets 0 and 8.
01552                             if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_gpr)
01553                                 throw Exception("byte access only valid for general purpose registers.");
01554                             if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01555                                 throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01556                             assert(reg.get_nbits()==8); // we had better be asking for a one-byte register (e.g., "ah", not "ax")
01557                             switch (reg.get_offset()) {
01558                                 case 0:
01559                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =                                    // no-op extend
01560                                         concat(signExtend<Len, 8>(value),
01561                                                extract<8, 32>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]));
01562                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01563                                     break;
01564                                 case 8:
01565                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =
01566                                         concat(extract<0, 8>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]),
01567                                                concat(unsignedExtend<Len, 8>(value),
01568                                                       extract<16, 32>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()])));
01569                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01570                                     break;
01571                                 default:
01572                                     throw Exception("invalid byte access offset");
01573                             }
01574                             break;
01575 
01576                         case 16:
01577                             if (reg.get_nbits()!=16)
01578                                 throw Exception("invalid 2-byte register");
01579                             if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
01580                                 throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for word granularity register access");
01581                             switch (reg.get_major()) {
01582                                 case x86_regclass_segment:
01583                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_segregs)
01584                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01585                                     cur_state.registers.segreg[reg.get_minor()] = unsignedExtend<Len, 16>(value);
01586                                     cur_state.registers.segreg[reg.get_minor()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01587                                     break;
01588                                 case x86_regclass_gpr:
01589                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01590                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01591                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =
01592                                         concat(unsignedExtend<Len, 16>(value),
01593                                                extract<16, 32>(cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()]));
01594                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01595                                     break;
01596                                 case x86_regclass_flags:
01597                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || cur_state.registers.n_flags<16)
01598                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01599                                     cur_state.registers.flag[0]  = extract<0,  1 >(value);
01600                                     cur_state.registers.flag[0].defined_by(cur_insn);
01601                                     cur_state.registers.flag[1]  = extract<1,  2 >(value);
01602                                     cur_state.registers.flag[1].defined_by(cur_insn);
01603                                     cur_state.registers.flag[2]  = extract<2,  3 >(value);
01604                                     cur_state.registers.flag[2].defined_by(cur_insn);
01605                                     cur_state.registers.flag[3]  = extract<3,  4 >(value);
01606                                     cur_state.registers.flag[3].defined_by(cur_insn);
01607                                     cur_state.registers.flag[4]  = extract<4,  5 >(value);
01608                                     cur_state.registers.flag[4].defined_by(cur_insn);
01609                                     cur_state.registers.flag[5]  = extract<5,  6 >(value);
01610                                     cur_state.registers.flag[5].defined_by(cur_insn);
01611                                     cur_state.registers.flag[6]  = extract<6,  7 >(value);
01612                                     cur_state.registers.flag[6].defined_by(cur_insn);
01613                                     cur_state.registers.flag[7]  = extract<7,  8 >(value);
01614                                     cur_state.registers.flag[7].defined_by(cur_insn);
01615                                     cur_state.registers.flag[8]  = extract<8,  9 >(value);
01616                                     cur_state.registers.flag[8].defined_by(cur_insn);
01617                                     cur_state.registers.flag[9]  = extract<9,  10>(value);
01618                                     cur_state.registers.flag[9].defined_by(cur_insn);
01619                                     cur_state.registers.flag[10] = extract<10, 11>(value);
01620                                     cur_state.registers.flag[10].defined_by(cur_insn);
01621                                     cur_state.registers.flag[11] = extract<11, 12>(value);
01622                                     cur_state.registers.flag[11].defined_by(cur_insn);
01623                                     cur_state.registers.flag[12] = extract<12, 13>(value);
01624                                     cur_state.registers.flag[12].defined_by(cur_insn);
01625                                     cur_state.registers.flag[13] = extract<13, 14>(value);
01626                                     cur_state.registers.flag[13].defined_by(cur_insn);
01627                                     cur_state.registers.flag[14] = extract<14, 15>(value);
01628                                     cur_state.registers.flag[14].defined_by(cur_insn);
01629                                     cur_state.registers.flag[15] = extract<15, 16>(value);
01630                                     cur_state.registers.flag[15].defined_by(cur_insn);
01631                                     break;
01632                                 default:
01633                                     throw Exception("word access not valid for this register type");
01634                             }
01635                             break;
01636 
01637                         case 32:
01638                             if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
01639                                 throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for double word granularity"
01640                                                 " register access");
01641                             switch (reg.get_major()) {
01642                                 case x86_regclass_gpr:
01643                                     if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.registers.n_gprs)
01644                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01645                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()] = signExtend<Len, 32>(value);
01646                                     cur_state.registers.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defined_by(cur_insn);
01647                                     break;
01648                                 case x86_regclass_ip:
01649                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
01650                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01651                                     cur_state.registers.ip = unsignedExtend<Len, 32>(value);
01652                                     cur_state.registers.ip.defined_by(cur_insn);
01653                                     break;
01654                                 case x86_regclass_flags:
01655                                     if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || cur_state.registers.n_flags<32)
01656                                         throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
01657                                     if (reg.get_nbits()!=32)
01658                                         throw Exception("register is not 32 bits");
01659                                     writeRegister<16>("flags", unsignedExtend<Len, 16>(value));
01660                                     cur_state.registers.flag[16] = extract<16, 17>(value);
01661                                     cur_state.registers.flag[16].defined_by(cur_insn);
01662                                     cur_state.registers.flag[17] = extract<17, 18>(value);
01663                                     cur_state.registers.flag[17].defined_by(cur_insn);
01664                                     cur_state.registers.flag[18] = extract<18, 19>(value);
01665                                     cur_state.registers.flag[18].defined_by(cur_insn);
01666                                     cur_state.registers.flag[19] = extract<19, 20>(value);
01667                                     cur_state.registers.flag[19].defined_by(cur_insn);
01668                                     cur_state.registers.flag[20] = extract<20, 21>(value);
01669                                     cur_state.registers.flag[20].defined_by(cur_insn);
01670                                     cur_state.registers.flag[21] = extract<21, 22>(value);
01671                                     cur_state.registers.flag[21].defined_by(cur_insn);
01672                                     cur_state.registers.flag[22] = extract<22, 23>(value);
01673                                     cur_state.registers.flag[22].defined_by(cur_insn);
01674                                     cur_state.registers.flag[23] = extract<23, 24>(value);
01675                                     cur_state.registers.flag[23].defined_by(cur_insn);
01676                                     cur_state.registers.flag[24] = extract<24, 25>(value);
01677                                     cur_state.registers.flag[24].defined_by(cur_insn);
01678                                     cur_state.registers.flag[25] = extract<25, 26>(value);
01679                                     cur_state.registers.flag[25].defined_by(cur_insn);
01680                                     cur_state.registers.flag[26] = extract<26, 27>(value);
01681                                     cur_state.registers.flag[26].defined_by(cur_insn);
01682                                     cur_state.registers.flag[27] = extract<27, 28>(value);
01683                                     cur_state.registers.flag[27].defined_by(cur_insn);
01684                                     cur_state.registers.flag[28] = extract<28, 29>(value);
01685                                     cur_state.registers.flag[28].defined_by(cur_insn);
01686                                     cur_state.registers.flag[29] = extract<29, 30>(value);
01687                                     cur_state.registers.flag[29].defined_by(cur_insn);
01688                                     cur_state.registers.flag[30] = extract<30, 31>(value);
01689                                     cur_state.registers.flag[30].defined_by(cur_insn);
01690                                     cur_state.registers.flag[31] = extract<31, 32>(value);
01691                                     cur_state.registers.flag[31].defined_by(cur_insn);
01692                                     break;
01693                                 default:
01694                                     throw Exception("double word access not valid for this register type");
01695                             }
01696                             break;
01697 
01698                         default:
01699                             throw Exception("invalid register access width");
01700                     }
01701                 }
01702 
01704                 template <size_t Len> ValueType<Len>
01705                 readMemory(X86SegmentRegister segreg, const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<1> &cond) const {
01706                     return mem_read<Len>(cur_state, addr);
01707                 }
01708 
01710                 template <size_t Len> void
01711                 writeMemory(X86SegmentRegister segreg, const ValueType<32> &addr, const ValueType<Len> &data,
01712                             const ValueType<1> &cond) {
01713                     mem_write<Len>(cur_state, addr, data);
01714                 }
01715             };
01716         } /*namespace*/
01717     } /*namespace*/
